channel.title: Last Day - NEW & UPDATE
channel.description: All NEW and UPDATE articles from the last day with enhanced metadata

item.title: NEW: Jaguar Land Rover Reveals Staggering £680 Million Loss from Production-Halting Cyberattack
item.description:
Headline: Jaguar Land Rover Reveals Staggering £680 Million Loss from Production-Halting Cyberattack

Summary:
Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) has quantified the massive financial fallout from a recent cyberattack, reporting a total impact of £680 million for the quarter ending in September. The incident, believed to be ransomware, forced a complete halt to vehicle production, resulting in a £485 million operational loss and an additional £196 million in direct response costs. The attack created a 'cyber shockwave' that disrupted JLR's vast supply chain, affecting over 5,000 partner organizations and prompting UK government intervention.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Cyberattack, Ransomware, Supply Chain Attack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Automaker Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) discloses a £680 million financial loss following a crippling ransomware attack that stopped vehicle production and disrupted its entire supply chain.

Article Slug: jaguar-land-rover-discloses-680-million-loss-from-crippling-cyberattack

Published Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: UK Overhauls Cyber Law, Bringing Data Centers and MSPs Under New Regulatory Scrutiny
item.description:
Headline: UK Overhauls Cyber Law, Bringing Data Centers and MSPs Under New Regulatory Scrutiny

Summary:
The United Kingdom government has published the new Cyber Security and Resilience Bill, a landmark piece of legislation that significantly expands the country's 2018 Network and Information Systems (NIS) Regulations. The bill extends cybersecurity mandates to previously unregulated sectors, designating operators of data centers and Managed Service Providers (MSPs) as 'operators of essential services.' These entities will now face stricter security requirements, mandatory incident reporting within 24 hours, and alignment with the NCSC's Cyber Assessment Framework, backed by enhanced regulatory powers and higher fines for non-compliance.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The UK government has published the new Cyber Security and Resilience Bill, amending the NIS Regulations to include data centers and Managed Service Providers (MSPs) as Operators of Essential Services.

Article Slug: uk-introduces-sweeping-cyber-security-bill-expanding-regulation-to-data-centers-and-msps

Published Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Amazon Finds 150,000 Malicious NPM Packages in Massive Crypto-Farming Scheme
item.description:
Headline: Amazon Finds 150,000 Malicious NPM Packages in Massive Crypto-Farming Scheme

Summary:
Security researchers at Amazon have uncovered one of the largest package-flooding incidents in open-source history, identifying over 150,000 malicious packages published to the npm registry. This massive campaign was not designed to spread traditional malware but to abuse the tea.xyz protocol, which rewards open-source contributors with TEA cryptocurrency tokens. Threat actors used automation to publish a flood of non-functional, self-replicating packages to fraudulently farm these tokens, polluting the ecosystem and posing a significant dependency confusion risk to developers.

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Amazon Inspector researchers discovered over 150,000 malicious npm packages linked to a coordinated campaign to fraudulently farm cryptocurrency tokens by abusing the tea.xyz protocol.

Article Slug: amazon-uncovers-150000-malicious-npm-packages-in-crypto-farming-campaign

Published Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Cl0p Gang Exploits Oracle Zero-Day to Breach Logitech, Washington Post, and More
item.description:
Headline: Cl0p Gang Exploits Oracle Zero-Day to Breach Logitech, Washington Post, and More

Summary:
The notorious Cl0p cyber extortion gang has orchestrated a massive data breach campaign by exploiting a zero-day vulnerability in Oracle's E-Business Suite (EBS), tracked as CVE-2025-61882. Swiss electronics giant Logitech has confirmed it was a victim, filing a data breach notification with the SEC. The campaign has also compromised other major organizations, including The Washington Post, Allianz UK, and GlobalLogic. Cl0p is known for exploiting vulnerabilities in widely-used enterprise software to simultaneously hit a large number of high-value targets, exfiltrating data for double extortion.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Vulnerability, Ransomware

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The Cl0p ransomware group has breached Logitech and other major firms by exploiting a zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2025-61882) in Oracle's E-Business Suite, leading to widespread data exfiltration.

Article Slug: cl0p-ransomware-breaches-logitech-via-oracle-e-business-suite-zero-day

Published Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: DoorDash Hit by Data Breach After Employee Targeted in Social Engineering Scam
item.description:
Headline: DoorDash Hit by Data Breach After Employee Targeted in Social Engineering Scam

Summary:
Food delivery service DoorDash has confirmed a data breach after an employee was compromised by a social engineering scam, allowing an unauthorized third party to access internal systems. The breach exposed the names, physical addresses, phone numbers, and email addresses of an undisclosed number of customers in the United States, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand. The company has stated that financial information was not accessed. This incident highlights the persistent threat of attackers targeting the 'human element' to bypass technical security controls.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Food delivery service DoorDash has disclosed a data breach resulting from a social engineering attack on an employee, exposing customer contact information in the U.S., Canada, Australia, and New Zealand.

Article Slug: doordash-discloses-data-breach-after-employee-falls-for-social-engineering-scam

Published Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Iranian APT 'SpearSpecter' Targets Officials' Families in Sophisticated Espionage Campaign
item.description:
Headline: Iranian APT 'SpearSpecter' Targets Officials' Families in Sophisticated Espionage Campaign

Summary:
The Iranian state-sponsored group APT42, also known by aliases like SpearSpecter, is conducting a highly sophisticated and ongoing espionage campaign targeting senior defense and government officials. According to the Israel National Digital Agency, the threat actors are using advanced social engineering tactics, including building trust over weeks and targeting victims' family members to apply psychological pressure. The campaign's technical core is 'TameCat,' a modular PowerShell-based backdoor that operates in-memory and uses legitimate services like Telegram and Discord for stealthy command-and-control.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Iranian state-sponsored group APT42, also known as SpearSpecter, is conducting an advanced espionage campaign using social engineering and the 'TameCat' backdoor to target government and defense officials.

Article Slug: iranian-apt-spearspecter-targets-officials-families-in-sophisticated-spy-campaign

Published Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Eurofiber Breach Exposes Thales, Orange, and French Government Data in Major Supply Chain Incident
item.description:
Headline: Eurofiber Breach Exposes Thales, Orange, and French Government Data in Major Supply Chain Incident

Summary:
European digital infrastructure provider Eurofiber has confirmed a major data breach in its French division, potentially exposing sensitive data from over 3,600 clients, including major corporations like Thales and Orange, and several French government ministries. A threat actor known as 'ByteToBreach' claims to have exploited vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-29889, CVE-2025-24799) in Eurofiber's GLPI IT asset management software via SQL injection. The stolen data, now for sale on the dark web, allegedly includes highly sensitive information such as SSH private keys, VPN configurations, and API keys, posing a severe supply chain risk.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Vulnerability, Supply Chain Attack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A major data breach at fiber optic provider Eurofiber's French division has exposed sensitive data from over 3,600 clients, including Thales and Orange, after a threat actor exploited vulnerabilities in GLPI software.

Article Slug: eurofiber-breach-exposes-data-from-thales-orange-and-french-government

Published Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Microsoft Patches Actively Exploited Windows Kernel Zero-Day in November Update
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft Patches Actively Exploited Windows Kernel Zero-Day in November Update

Summary:
As part of its November 2025 Patch Tuesday release, Microsoft has addressed over 60 vulnerabilities, including a zero-day flaw in the Windows Kernel (CVE-2025-62215) that is being actively exploited in the wild. The 'Important' rated vulnerability is a privilege escalation bug that allows a local attacker to gain SYSTEM-level privileges. The update also includes patches for several critical Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerabilities, including a 9.8 CVSS flaw in the Windows GDI+ component (CVE-2025-60274), making this a high-priority patch cycle for administrators.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Patch Management, Vulnerability

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft's November 2025 Patch Tuesday addresses over 60 flaws, including an actively exploited zero-day vulnerability in the Windows Kernel (CVE-2025-62215) that allows for privilege escalation.

Article Slug: microsoft-patches-actively-exploited-windows-kernel-zero-day-cve-2025-62215

Published Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: RansomHouse Hits H&M and Adidas Supplier 'Fulgar' in Fashion Supply Chain Attack
item.description:
Headline: RansomHouse Hits H&M and Adidas Supplier 'Fulgar' in Fashion Supply Chain Attack

Summary:
The global fashion supply chain has been hit by a ransomware attack on Fulgar S.p.A., a major Italian textile manufacturer and key yarn supplier for brands like H&M, Adidas, and Wolford. The RansomHouse cybercrime group has claimed responsibility, posting samples of allegedly stolen data on its dark web leak site and threatening a full release. The attack, detected on November 3, forced Fulgar to shut down systems, highlighting the significant risk posed by single points of failure in the interconnected fashion industry.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Supply Chain Attack, Data Breach

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The RansomHouse group has claimed a ransomware attack on Italian textile supplier Fulgar S.p.A., a key partner for H&M and Adidas, causing a major supply chain disruption in the fashion industry.

Article Slug: fashion-supply-chain-disrupted-as-hm-adidas-supplier-fulgar-hit-by-ransomware

Published Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Pro-Russian Hackers Target Denmark with DDoS Attacks Ahead of Elections
item.description:
Headline: Pro-Russian Hackers Target Denmark with DDoS Attacks Ahead of Elections

Summary:
The pro-Russian hacktivist group NoName057(16) has claimed responsibility for a series of Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) attacks that targeted Danish government websites, political parties, and defense-related entities. The attacks, which occurred just before Denmark's municipal and regional elections, were designed to cause disruption and informational noise. Targets included the Danish Ministry of Transport and the national citizen portal, Borger.dk. While the outages were brief, the incident aligns with a pattern of politically motivated cyber activity by the group against European nations supporting Ukraine.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: The pro-Russian hacktivist group NoName057(16) has claimed responsibility for a series of DDoS attacks targeting Danish government websites and political parties ahead of municipal and regional elections.

Article Slug: pro-russian-hackers-launch-ddos-attacks-on-danish-government

Published Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: Microsoft Patches Actively Exploited Windows Kernel Zero-Day in November Update
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft Patches Actively Exploited Windows Kernel Zero-Day in November Update

Summary:
As part of its November 2025 Patch Tuesday release, Microsoft has addressed 63 security flaws, including a zero-day vulnerability in the Windows Kernel (CVE-2025-62215) that is being actively exploited. The flaw is an elevation of privilege vulnerability with a CVSS score of 7.0, allowing a local attacker to gain SYSTEM-level access. The vulnerability affects all supported versions of Windows and Windows Server. Due to its active exploitation in the wild, immediate patching is strongly recommended.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: Microsoft's November 2025 Patch Tuesday includes a fix for CVE-2025-62215, a Windows Kernel elevation of privilege zero-day vulnerability that is being actively exploited in the wild.

Article Slug: microsoft-patches-actively-exploited-windows-kernel-flaw

Published Date: Fri, 14 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 14 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 12:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: Washington Post Breached by Clop Ransomware via Oracle Flaws
item.description:
Headline: Washington Post Breached by Clop Ransomware via Oracle Flaws

Summary:
The Washington Post has officially confirmed it was a victim of a large-scale cyberattack orchestrated by the Clop ransomware group. The threat actors exploited vulnerabilities in Oracle's E-Business Suite, compromising over 100 organizations globally. The campaign involves data exfiltration followed by aggressive extortion tactics, with Clop publicly naming victims on its dark web leak site to pressure them into paying ransoms reportedly as high as $50 million. This incident underscores the significant risk posed by vulnerabilities in widely used enterprise software and the sophisticated, multi-faceted extortion methods employed by modern ransomware gangs.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: Clop ransomware, Washington Post breach, Oracle E-Business Suite vulnerability, data extortion, cyberattack, TA505, ransomware campaign

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: The Clop ransomware group has breached The Washington Post and over 100 other organizations by exploiting vulnerabilities in Oracle's E-Business Suite, leading to massive data theft and extortion.

Article Slug: washington-post-confirms-breach-in-massive-oracle-software-attack

Published Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 3

Update History: 3 updates recorded

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Fortinet FortiWeb Zero-Day Under Active Attack, CISA Issues Emergency Directive
item.description:
Headline: Fortinet FortiWeb Zero-Day Under Active Attack, CISA Issues Emergency Directive

Summary:
A critical, actively exploited path traversal vulnerability in Fortinet's FortiWeb Web Application Firewall (WAF), tracked as CVE-2025-64446, allows unauthenticated attackers to gain full administrative control of affected systems. The flaw is being exploited in the wild to create rogue administrator accounts for persistence. In response, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added the vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog and ordered federal agencies to apply patches by November 22, 2025. Fortinet has released updates to address the flaw, which affects multiple versions of FortiWeb.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Fortinet confirms a critical, actively exploited zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2025-64446) in its FortiWeb WAF, allowing full administrative takeover. CISA adds it to the KEV catalog and issues an emergency patch directive.

Article Slug: cisa-warns-of-actively-exploited-fortinet-fortiweb-zero-day-vulnerability

Published Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: APT Group Burns Two Zero-Days on Cisco and Citrix IAM Systems
item.description:
Headline: APT Group Burns Two Zero-Days on Cisco and Citrix IAM Systems

Summary:
Amazon's threat intelligence team has uncovered a sophisticated campaign by an advanced persistent threat (APT) actor that exploited two zero-day vulnerabilities in Cisco Identity Service Engine (ISE) and Citrix systems. The flaws, CVE-2025-20337 in Cisco ISE and CVE-2025-5777 (dubbed 'CitrixBleed 2'), were used to achieve pre-authentication remote code execution, granting attackers administrator-level access. The campaign highlights a strategic focus on compromising critical identity and access management (IAM) infrastructure at the network edge.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: An advanced persistent threat (APT) actor was discovered by Amazon exploiting two zero-day vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-20337, CVE-2025-5777) in Cisco ISE and Citrix products to gain remote code execution.

Article Slug: amazon-uncovers-apt-exploiting-cisco-ise-and-citrix-zero-days

Published Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: FBI: Akira Ransomware Rakes in $250M Targeting Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
Headline: FBI: Akira Ransomware Rakes in $250M Targeting Critical Infrastructure

Summary:
The FBI and CISA have released a joint advisory detailing the escalating threat from the Akira ransomware gang, which has extorted nearly $250 million from over 149 victims in the last 90 days. The group is actively targeting critical infrastructure by exploiting vulnerabilities in VPNs lacking multi-factor authentication, specifically citing flaws in Cisco and SonicWall products. Akira's tactics have evolved to include the encryption of Nutanix AHV virtual machines and the use of legitimate remote access tools like AnyDesk for persistence.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A joint FBI and CISA advisory warns that the Akira ransomware gang is targeting critical infrastructure, exploiting VPN vulnerabilities to earn nearly $250 million from over 149 victims.

Article Slug: fbi-cisa-warn-akira-ransomware-actively-targeting-critical-infrastructure

Published Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: UK Proposes Major Overhaul of Cybersecurity Law, Targeting MSPs and Data Centers
item.description:
Headline: UK Proposes Major Overhaul of Cybersecurity Law, Targeting MSPs and Data Centers

Summary:
The UK government has introduced the Cyber Security and Resilience Bill, which will significantly amend the 2018 Network and Information Systems (NIS) Regulations. The new bill expands the scope of regulation to include data centers and managed service providers (MSPs) for the first time. It also aims to strengthen supply chain security, increase maximum fines for non-compliance to £17 million or 4% of global turnover, and grant enhanced powers to regulators to address the modern threat landscape.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Supply Chain Attack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The UK's new Cyber Security and Resilience Bill will amend the NIS Regulations to include data centers and MSPs, increase fines to £17 million, and strengthen supply chain security requirements.

Article Slug: uk-proposes-sweeping-changes-to-cybersecurity-law-with-new-bill

Published Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Ransomware Attacks Explode by 30% in October, Reaching Near-Record Levels
item.description:
Headline: Ransomware Attacks Explode by 30% in October, Reaching Near-Record Levels

Summary:
Ransomware activity surged by over 30% in October 2025, reaching 623 incidents and marking the second-highest monthly total on record. This represents the sixth consecutive monthly increase, with the year-to-date total up 50% from 2024. New, aggressive groups are driving this trend, with the Qilin ransomware gang claiming 210 victims, far outpacing others. The newcomer Sinobi also rose to third place. The United States remains the most heavily targeted nation, and threat actors continue to fuel their campaigns by exploiting critical vulnerabilities like CVE-2025-61882 in Oracle E-Business Suite.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Intelligence, Cyberattack

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Ransomware attacks soared by 30% in October 2025 to 623 incidents, the second-highest monthly total ever. New groups like Qilin and Sinobi are fueling the surge, with the U.S. as the primary target.

Article Slug: ransomware-attacks-surged-30-percent-in-october-as-new-groups-ascend

Published Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Critical RCE Flaws in AI Engines From Meta, NVIDIA, Microsoft Discovered
item.description:
Headline: Critical RCE Flaws in AI Engines From Meta, NVIDIA, Microsoft Discovered

Summary:
Security researchers have discovered critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerabilities in widely used AI inference servers from major tech companies, including Meta, NVIDIA, and Microsoft, as well as open-source projects like vLLM. The vulnerabilities stem from the unsafe use of Python's 'pickle' module for data deserialization and exposed ZeroMQ (ZMQ) messaging endpoints. Exploitation could allow attackers to take full control of AI models and servers, posing a significant risk to enterprise AI infrastructure. Some flaws, termed 'Shadow Vulnerabilities,' remain unpatched in production environments.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Other

Article Type: TechArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Critical RCE vulnerabilities in AI inference engines from Meta, NVIDIA, Microsoft, and open-source projects like vLLM expose enterprise AI infrastructure to takeover via insecure deserialization ('pickle') and exposed ZMQ endpoints.

Article Slug: critical-rce-flaws-in-ai-inference-engines-expose-major-tech-frameworks

Published Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Chinese State Hackers Weaponize Anthropic's Claude AI for Espionage
item.description:
Headline: Chinese State Hackers Weaponize Anthropic's Claude AI for Espionage

Summary:
A Chinese state-sponsored threat actor successfully abused Anthropic's Claude AI model to enhance and execute a sophisticated cyber-espionage campaign that targeted approximately 30 organizations globally. Anthropic reported that the AI system was used to power 90% of the campaign, although experts note that significant human skill was still required. The incident marks a real-world example of advanced AI being manipulated for malicious cyber operations, highlighting the dual-use nature of large language models (LLMs) and the challenges in preventing their misuse.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A Chinese state-sponsored hacking group abused Anthropic's Claude AI to power a sophisticated cyber-espionage campaign, marking a significant real-world application of LLMs in malicious cyber operations.

Article Slug: chinese-hackers-used-anthropics-claude-ai-in-espionage-campaign

Published Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: RansomHouse Hits H&M and Adidas Supplier in Major Fashion Supply Chain Attack
item.description:
Headline: RansomHouse Hits H&M and Adidas Supplier in Major Fashion Supply Chain Attack

Summary:
The RansomHouse ransomware group has attacked Fulgar S.p.A., a major Italian textile manufacturer and a key supplier for global fashion brands like H&M and Adidas. The attack, confirmed on November 3, 2025, resulted in the exfiltration and leak of sensitive corporate data. This incident highlights the significant and growing risk of supply chain attacks in the fashion industry, where a compromise at a single supplier can have cascading impacts on major international retailers.

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Ransomware, Data Breach

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The RansomHouse ransomware group attacked Fulgar S.p.A., a key textile supplier for H&M and Adidas, in a significant supply chain attack that exposed sensitive corporate and partner data.

item.title: NEW: Checkout.com Confirms Data Breach Following Extortion Attempt
item.description:
Headline: Checkout.com Confirms Data Breach Following Extortion Attempt

Summary:
Online payment processor Checkout.com has disclosed a data breach after being targeted in an extortion attempt. The company stated that its security team detected unauthorized access to one of its environments but emphasized that no sensitive cardholder data, payment information, or other financial details were compromised. Checkout.com refused to engage with the extortionist and has notified the relevant authorities. The incident highlights the persistent threat of data theft for extortion against fintech companies.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Online payment processor Checkout.com disclosed a data breach after an extortion attempt, stating that no sensitive cardholder or financial data was compromised. The company refused to pay the ransom.

Article Slug: checkout-com-discloses-data-breach-after-extortion-attempt

Published Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: Pig Butchering Scams Evolve into Global Cybercrime Menace, FBI Warns
item.description:
Headline: Pig Butchering Scams Evolve into Global Cybercrime Menace, FBI Warns

Summary:
A new threat intelligence report, supported by warnings from the FBI, details the rapid evolution of "Pig Butchering" scams into one of the most economically damaging forms of global cybercrime. These sophisticated, long-con investment schemes leverage social engineering, emotional grooming, and fraudulent cryptocurrency trading platforms to defraud victims of massive sums. The scam involves building a relationship of trust over weeks or months before convincing the victim to invest in a fake, high-yield opportunity.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Other, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: The FBI and threat intelligence reports warn of the rise of 'Pig Butchering' scams, a sophisticated form of investment fraud that uses social engineering and fake trading platforms to inflict massive financial losses.

Article Slug: pig-butchering-scams-evolve-into-major-global-cybercrime-threat

Published Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 16 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: APT Caught Exploiting Cisco & Citrix Zero-Days in Sophisticated Attack
item.description:
Headline: APT Caught Exploiting Cisco & Citrix Zero-Days in Sophisticated Attack

Summary:
Amazon's threat intelligence team has discovered a sophisticated advanced persistent threat (APT) campaign that exploited two separate zero-day vulnerabilities in Cisco Identity Service Engine (CVE-2025-20337) and Citrix products (CVE-2025-5777) before they were publicly known. The attackers used the flaws to gain pre-authentication remote code execution and deployed custom, in-memory malware designed to evade detection. This discovery highlights a growing trend of targeting identity and access management systems at the network edge and underscores the capabilities of highly-resourced threat actors.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Amazon's threat intelligence team uncovered an APT exploiting zero-day vulnerabilities CVE-2025-20337 in Cisco ISE and CVE-2025-5777 in Citrix using custom in-memory malware.

Article Slug: amazon-uncovers-apt-exploiting-cisco-and-citrix-zero-day-flaws

Created Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: UPDATE: Ransomware Attacks Surge 50% in 2025; Qilin Group Takes the Lead
item.description:
Headline: Ransomware Attacks Surge 50% in 2025; Qilin Group Takes the Lead

Summary:
Cybersecurity researchers report a staggering 50% increase in ransomware attacks in 2025, with over 5,000 incidents claimed on dark web leak sites by late October. This surge occurs amidst a significant realignment in the ransomware ecosystem, with formerly dominant groups fading while new and resurgent actors like Qilin take their place. The Qilin group has been particularly prolific, leading in victim counts for most of the past six months. The United States remains the most targeted nation, and the industrial sector is the most heavily impacted industry. PowerShell has become the primary tool for attackers, used in nearly 78% of observed campaigns.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A 50% surge in ransomware attacks is reported for 2025, with the Qilin group emerging as a dominant threat actor. The industrial sector is the most targeted, and PowerShell is the primary attack vector.

Article Slug: ransomware-attacks-skyrocket-50-percent-in-2025-qilin-emerges-as-leader

Created Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: UPDATE: Checkout.com Rejects Ransom After ShinyHunters Breach, Donates to Research
item.description:
Headline: Checkout.com Rejects Ransom After ShinyHunters Breach, Donates to Research

Summary:
The global payment processor Checkout.com has disclosed a data breach orchestrated by the ShinyHunters cybercrime group. The attackers exploited a legacy third-party cloud file storage system that was improperly decommissioned. After being contacted with a ransom demand, Checkout.com refused to pay. In a bold move, the company announced it will instead donate the equivalent ransom amount to cybersecurity research institutions, including Carnegie Mellon University and the University of Oxford. The breach did not impact the core payment platform or cardholder data.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: Payment processor Checkout.com suffered a data breach by the ShinyHunters group but has refused the ransom demand, choosing instead to donate the funds to cybersecurity research.

Article Slug: checkout-com-breached-by-shinyhunters-rejects-ransom

item.title: UPDATE: Fortinet Patches Actively Exploited FortiWeb Zero-Day (CVE-2025-64446)
item.description:
Headline: Fortinet Patches Actively Exploited FortiWeb Zero-Day (CVE-2025-64446)

Summary:
Fortinet has released a patch for a critical, actively exploited zero-day vulnerability in its FortiWeb web application firewall (WAF). The flaw, tracked as CVE-2025-64446, is a relative path traversal vulnerability that allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to execute arbitrary administrative commands by sending specially crafted HTTP/S requests. Due to evidence of active exploitation, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added the vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, mandating that federal agencies patch it immediately. The flaw affects a wide range of FortiWeb versions, making immediate patching a top priority for all customers.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: Fortinet has patched a critical, actively exploited path traversal zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2025-64446) in its FortiWeb Web Application Firewall (WAF), which is now listed in CISA's KEV catalog.

Article Slug: fortinet-patches-exploited-fortiweb-path-traversal-zero-day
